QuestionJSON.Question:
Jaime is using JavaScript to simulate a basic physics problem for their science class. They have written code that calculates acceleration given the net force applied and the mass of the object. Which of the following choices is the best way for Jaime to document design decisions in the development of this program?

1let netForce = F; // Net force applied on the object
2let mass = m; // Mass of the object
3// Acceleration is calculated by dividing net force by mass
4let acceleration = netForce / mass;
QuestionJSON.Answer1: Include a visual diagram of the forces being applied to the object in the project.
QuestionJSON.Answer2: Include code comments explaining how acceleration is calculated from net force and mass.
QuestionJSON.Answer3: Present the project to the class, explaining the physics behind the program.
QuestionJSON.Explanation: All these methods are valid ways of documenting design decisions. Visual diagrams help visualize the problem, comments help understand the code, and presentations help demonstrate how it all comes together.
QuestionJSON.Code_Snippet:
1let netForce = F; // Net force applied on the object
2let mass = m; // Mass of the object
3// Acceleration is calculated by dividing net force by mass
4let acceleration = netForce / mass;
